armour.name: Superior moral boots
armour.description: You gain 5% AG. You can consume 1 hit of Superior moral boots as a 1 tick action to show a minion how cool you think they are: 30% chance their actions are denied in this tick.
armour.note: They are so cool! Yeah… Awesome! Definitely not a lie.

armour.name: Magazines
armour.description: Magazines interrupts an attack made with Throwing knives.
armour.note: Yare yare daze. Now my valuable uniform is full of holes!

miscellaneous.name: Jean-Paul Gaultier's pour homme
miscellaneous.description: Multiple item loot. Lie shamelessly to a Neutral minion with success.

weapons.name: Cotton Candy Mace
weapons.description: You can consume 2 uses of the Cotton Candy Mace as a bribe or consume 1 use to restore 2 HPs. Hitting a minion with this weapon makes them sticky. They have to spend 1 tick cleaning themselves up or they are immobilized. If you get hit with water when holding the Cotton Candy Mace, it melts.
weapons.note: Thousands of clouds are killed every year to make cotton candy.

armour.name: Black Mambaaaaa
armour.description: You can take a 1 tick action to argue with an enemy about being a villain. There is a 50% chance they reply and their actions are denied in the current tick.

armour.name: Cousin Itt’s fluff
armour.description: You are immune to ranged attacks, you take half the sound damage (rounded up), but you suffer twice the fire damage. Lose 5% AG.
armour.note: Can you hear me down there?

spells.name: Left alone
spells.description: Target minion stinks so badly in this tick so that anyone in a 1 hexes radius area gets their actions denied and spends this tick walking away in disgust. The smelly one also interrupts their actions crying with shame.

miscellaneous.name: Dandelion
miscellaneous.description: Eat it to heal 3 HPs. Consuming Dandelion while looting increases your LK by 2.
miscellaneous.note: Must be the last one of the season!

miscellaneous.name: Extract of llama
miscellaneous.description: Turn into a llama for 5 ticks. You keep your equipment but your only attack is replaced by Magical Spitball at no mana cost. Alternatively you can launch this item up to 3 hexes away to apply the same effect. Unfriendly entities can try to dodge this as if it was a ranged attack.
miscellaneous.note: A llama? He’s supposed to be dead!

miscellaneous.name: Werehorn
miscellaneous.description: This item makes you emulate a wolf’s call: for any minion in a 5 hexes radius area, there is a 25% chance their actions are denied in this tick. Werehorn counts as an instrument for a Bard.

weapons.name: Java-elin-nothing-special
weapons.description: Your target must be at least 2 hexes away. If your target is 4 or more hexes away, double the damage. You have to recover this item any time you throw it.

armour.name: Turtle shell
armour.description: You can consume 3 hits from this item with an instantaneous action, to retreat into the shell and interrupt an attack or a spell that targets you. Lose 10% AG.
armour.note: Maremma impestata Alvaruccio! Te tu m’ha fatto rompere tutt’l mi guscio.

spells.name: Hamlet
spells.description: Summon a powerful hurricane that sweeps enemies 3 hexes away denying their actions in this tick. If they bump into a wall, they take 3 damage and stay stunned the next tick.
spells.note: Hi Ophelia, I’m a tornado! Brawlrllrlrrlrlrl.

armour.name: Best employee’ suit
armour.description: When you fail lying to a minion, you can consume one hit to make them believe you with a 25% chance after all.
armour.note: Insert a funny joke about dressing.

armour.name: Work uniform
armour.description: Consuming 1 hit you gain a 25% additional chance to successfully lie to a minion.

miscellaneous.name: Permit A38
miscellaneous.description: Use it to lie to another minion with success.
miscellaneous.note: I already told you once the port is down by the seaside!
